ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.modules.scheme

Class IMEXESDIRKModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.property.PropertyUser
      • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.solver.SolverModule
        • ca.usask.simlab.odeToJava.modules.scheme.IMEXESDIRKModule

  • public class IMEXESDIRKModule
extends SolverModule
    A module that calls a linearly implicit Runge-Kutta method with arbitrary explicit and implicit-ESDIRK (explicit diagonally implicit Runge-Kutta method) Butcher tableaux.

    Christopher A. Kennedy, Mark H. Carpenter. "Additive Runge-Kutta schemes for convection-diffusion-reaction equations.". Applied numerical mathematics, vol. 44, pg.139-181, 2003.

    Sebastiano Boscarino. "On an accurate third order implicit-explicit Rungeâ€“Kutta method for stiff problems", Applied Numerical Mathematics, vol. 59, pg. 1515-1528, 2009.

      • evaluate_flinear

        protected org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector evaluate_flinear(org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 t,
                                                              org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector y)
        Evaluate the linear part of the ODE. If the ODE does not already have a splitting, the Jacobian matrix is used to perform an autosplitting with Jy being the linear portion.
        Parameters:
        t - The time to do the evaluation.
        y - The solution to use in the RHS evaluation.
        Returns:
        The linear part of the RHS evaluation at the time with the given solution value.

      • evaluate_fnonlinear

        protected org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector evaluate_fnonlinear(org.jscience.mathematics.numbers.Float64 t,
                                                                 org.jscience.mathematics.vectors.Float64Vector y)
        Evaluate the nonlinear part of the ODE. If the ODE does not already have a splitting, the Jacobian matrix is used to perform an autosplitting with Jy being the linear portion.
        Parameters:
        t - The time to do the evaluation.
        y - The solution to use in the RHS evaluation.
        Returns:
        The nonlinear part of the RHS evaluation at the time with the given solution value.
